radiographic_examinations.findings: Stability of the lesions and previously undetected vertebral metastatic focus.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially stable but eventually developed progression of the disease with liver failure.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Computed tomography scan of the chest, abdomen and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.findings: Hypervascular intraluminal mass in the terminal ileum, hepatomegaly (207 mm) with more than 10 solid hypervascular lesions with necrotic/cystic areas, the largest measuring 108 mm, and bilateral ovarian metastatic nodules.
Thickening and retraction of the tricuspid valve leaflets, moderate to severe regurgitation, coherent with carcinoid heart disease.
Hepatomegaly with multiple space-occupying lesions consistent with diffuse liver metastasis.
